intro: Patersonia occidentalis var. eriostephana, commonly known as the western patersonia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant produces striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, often with a yellow or white center. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or grassland habitats. The leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
